reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely four night stay during easter at Hotel Duret, and would love to stay there again. It has a good location, only a five minute walk to the Arch the la Triumph, and three minutes to the nearest matro stop Argentine.
reviews.title: Pricy, but nice boutique style hotel at a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a standard room, but it was pricy, about 220euro a night... However, the room had a nice modern decor, the bed was a queen so on the small side, minibar, tv and a nice tiled bathroom with a bathtub. The downside was that the soundproofing, we could hear the tv from our neighbours and we were waken in the morning by the voices from the hall and nearest rooms.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Duret, but we will try to find somewhere less expensive next time.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked directly with the Hotel Website and got a good deal for a deluxe room with breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the airfrance bus from cdg and a 5 minute walk to the Argentine Metro station. It is in a safe mainly residential area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel... Fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Duret for 5 days at the end of June. Great stay. The decor of the hotel and the room was hip and elegant. We had a deluxe room on the 6th floor. Although there were only 2 twin beds, we pushed them together and it was perfectly fine. The room and bathroom were nicely appointed and very clean. The views of the street and the courtyard behind the building were charming. The staff, without fail, was lovely, helpful and patient with our feeble attempts to speak French (their English was, of course, perfect so we had no communication problems). It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and under a 10 minute walk to the Champs d' Elise. The metro was just a few minutes away. Excellent pastry shop right on the corner. While the neighborhood wasn't the most charming in the city, it was still very nice and everything we needed and wanted to see was readily available. Heartily recommend this hotel. We hope to return someday!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, lovely staff

likes.disliked: — unerwhelming breakfast offering...but not a big deal at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my boyfriend in February and what a great hotel. Location was excellent and the staff there were fab, so helpful. Great little restaurants near by as well and we were able to walk to a lot of the main tourist spots! Would def stay here again. Decor was really cool and the bathroom was lovely, big and clean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: 10min walk past the Arc de Triomphe. 5 mins to the metro. Safe & friendly.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We stayed in a double. Regular european sized room. Cleanliness was very good. Bathroom was small but very good. Bed was good, nice and firm. Trendy decor.
reviews.title: Relaxing and beautiful modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: The staff were helpful, no problems.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel on tripadvisor by doing the same thing you are doing now....reading the reviews from others. I am pleased to say that our experience at the Hotel Duret validated our expectations based on the numerous positive reviews here.
reviews.title: Great Experience
Great Paris hotel, but the location could be better
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the small rooms. We expected it to be small, but we like each other so it was cozy. I have traveled in Europe many times and I am used to the smallish hotel rooms. The small rooms would be just fine for a happy couple. Not so much for a guy trip, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was great. It has a trendy feel to it while retaining its character. Everyone we encountered at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They gave us a great sushi recommendation just across the Avenue Grand Armee (forget the name).
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect. We were looking for something that had an authentic Parisian feel rather than a tourist trap. I think we found it. The hotel is situated in a residential area with several cafes. It is also right on the metro, which by the way is the best public transportation system I have ever experienced. You can get anywhere in Paris in 20 minutes. However, don't take the metro everywhere -- walk to the Arch, down the Champs, and over to the Eiffel tower. These are all easy and safe walks and the only way to truly experience Paris.
reviews.title: Loved Duret

likes.disliked: — tiny lift... with our luggage, it was a couple of trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again and would recommend the Duret to friends and family. Ignore the few negative comments on here and keep and mind that there are some people out there that you just cannot please. We all know a few...
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.text: My niece and I spent four wonderful days in Paris. We had an absolute
reviews.title: Very special little hotel!!!

likes.liked: — the room was amazing and bathroom was wonderful

reviews.text: ball and plan to return next spring. I found the Hotel Duret on the internet and we were absolutely thrilled. The hotel is in the 16th Arrondisement on the rue Duret; it is a block or so from the Arc de Triomphe and within a 2 minute walk to the Metro. Also there are bus stops nearby.
reviews.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe, twin bedded room and we were delighted. The room was very large with a window overlooking the rooftops of Paris (it was like being in a movie). The bathroom was sleek and modern with slate floors and an enormous bathtub with shower and a huge sink. Very American for those who are afraid of small European bathrooms. There was a heated towel rack where we dried our underwear after rinsing them out!!!
reviews.title: FAB HOTEL AND LOCATION

likes.disliked: — the lack of a 'proper' bar area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downstairs there is a lovely little bar with small tables and comfy sofas to sit on; the breakfast room is nice (but we only had breakfast there once because 16 euros is a lot for breakfast but it's good if you want it); and there is another small lounge with a laptop computer to access the Internet (free!!).
reviews.title: Choose this hotel when in Paris....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have only ONE, tiny complaint . . . the elevator is very, very small!! Only two people can squeeze on at a time and only if you aren't too fat!!! But we easily overlooked that. Everything else was wonderful.
reviews.title: perfect for paris
